ygData.subject: Posting delays
ygData.msgSnippet: Another thing - I m sorry for the long delays in postings to the User s Group some of you have experienced.  The problem is that I have to approve the posts

Another thing -

I'm sorry for the long delays in postings to the User's Group some of  
you have experienced.  The problem is that I have to approve the  
posts from new members who have not previously posted, in order to  
check that they are not spammers. Once I see that the message is  
legit, I approve it.  And if I remember to do it, I change the  
sender's profile so that he/she can post without requiring approval.   
Unfortunately, due to lots of other committments, days can go by  
before I check on pending messages requiring approval...

If you are experiencing a delay in a post you have submitted, send me  
an email directly reminding me to check for pending messages... And  
if you want to get authorized to post without my prior approval, send  
me a message too.  If your e-mail address appears legit (a  
university, research lab, or company that would legitimately use  
Cantera) then you'll be approved and can see your posts show up  
immediately. For example, "jim@..." would be approved  
but not  "jim@...",  If you're using a Yahoo,  
Gmail, or other account, then you'll have to wait until you do one  
moderated post, since spammers use these email accounts quite a bit.

And finally - to all Cantera users:  Happy New Year!

Dave
